org.threadly.litesockets.buffers

Class TransactionalByteBuffers

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.buffers.AbstractMergedByteBuffers
      • org.threadly.litesockets.buffers.ReuseableMergedByteBuffers
        • org.threadly.litesockets.buffers.TransactionalByteBuffers
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MergedByteBuffers

    public class TransactionalByteBuffers
extends ReuseableMergedByteBuffers
    This allows you to used MergedByteBuffers in a transactional way. This can be useful when reading from the socket using a protocol that is not framed. NOTE: If you are modifying the data in the underlying byteArrays that will not be reverted

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.threadly.litesockets.buffers.MergedByteBuffers

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransactionalByteBuffers

        public TransactionalByteBuffers()

        public TransactionalByteBuffers(boolean readOnly)

    • Method Detail

      • begin

        public void begin()
        This mark the beginning of a new transaction. anything done from this point can either be committed or rolled back and forgotten. If an operation is done with out using begin it is committed immediately on completion.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Commit a already started transaction. Until this is done anything pulled out of the consolidator can be reverted. once this happens all changes are permanent and forever.

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        This allows you to roll back all operations done on the consolidator since the begin was called. NOTE: If you are modifying the data in the underlying byteArrays that will not be reverted

      • get

        public byte get()
        Description copied from interface: MergedByteBuffers

      • discard

        public void discard(int size)
        Description copied from interface: MergedByteBuffers
        Discard will drop how ever many bytes you tell it to on the floor.
        Specified by:
